message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "The study utilizes data from the World Development Indicators and the Global Population Dynamics Database to examine the changing patterns of poverty and population growth worldwide.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "Global Population Dynamics Database"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This research draws on household surveys conducted in sub-Saharan African nations from 2010 to 2020 and uses econometric models to analyze the determinants of food security among smallholder farmers.", "dataset": ["household surveys conducted in sub-Saharan African nations"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed data from several sources, including the International Energy Agency (IEA) and the Global Carbon Project, to assess the impact of different energy policies on greenhouse gas emissions worldwide.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency (IEA)", "Global Carbon Project"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using comprehensive health surveys and administrative health records, this study examined the relationship between socioeconomic status and maternal and child health outcomes in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["comprehensive health surveys", "administrative health records"], "topic": ["Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We utilized data from the Doing Business project, the World Economic Forum, and the International Finance Corporation to compare the business environment and economic competitiveness of different countries around the world.", "dataset": ["Doing Business project", "World Economic Forum", "International Finance Corporation"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the impact of air pollution on public health, we combined data from ground-based monitors, satellite remote sensing, and an epidemiological survey of respiratory disease incidence in major urban centers across Europe.", "dataset": ["ground-based monitors", "satellite remote sensing", "epidemiological survey of respiratory disease incidence"], "topic": ["Environment", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We evaluated the effectiveness of public-private partnerships in infrastructure development by analyzing extensive data on PPP projects from the World Bank's Private Participation in Infrastructure Database.", "dataset": ["Private Participation in Infrastructure Database"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "This study explores the relationship between international migration and remittances using data from the United Nations, the International Organization for Migration, and the World Bank's Migration and Remittance data portal.", "dataset": ["United Nations", "International Organization for Migration", "Migration and Remittance data portal"], "topic": ["Migration"]}, {"sentence": "We used a diverse array of economic and financial datasets to construct an early warning system for predicting episodes of financial instability in emerging markets.", "dataset": ["economic and financial datasets"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "By integrating geospatial data on land use change and agricultural practices with economic data on market competition, we examined the potential for sustainable intensification of agriculture in tropical regions with high environmental risks.", "dataset": ["geospatial data on land use change", "economic data on market competition"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Environment"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "The study utilizes data from the World Development Indicators and the Global Population Dynamics Database to examine the changing patterns of poverty and population growth
